Title: GitPython: Code Execution via Crafted Input
Synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in GitPython where crafted input to Repo.clone_from can lead to code execution

Background.Text: GitPython is a Python library used to interact with Git repositories.

Description.Text: Please review the CVE identifier referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: An attacker may be able to trigger Remote Code Execution (RCE) due to improper user input validation, which makes it possible to inject a maliciously crafted remote URL into the clone command. Exploiting this vulnerability is possible because the library makes external calls to git without sufficient sanitization of input arguments.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All GitPython users should upgrade to the latest version:
